summary: Elendil, a character in J.R.R. Tolkien's stories, was a great leader. He was a father to Isildur and Anárion and the last lord of Númenor, an island that sank in a flood. Elendil escaped and became the first king of Arnor and Gondor in Middle-earth. During a war against the Dark Lord Sauron, Elendil fought bravely but was killed, like his ally Gil-galad. His son then took the powerful One Ring. Tolkien compared Elendil to Noah from the Bible.
title: Elendil
